content: close to a round taking care not to twist the cast-on work k2 p2 rib for as many rounds as you would like your cuff to be i did 24 rounds for my sam- ple on my sample socks i actually worked the cuff with 80 sts and decreased down to 72 sts in the first plain k round if you have larger calves and/or don t like tight cuffs this may be an option to consider whether you have worked a decrease round or not k one round plain join your second colour and k one round with colour 2 leg work the leg according to the leg chart working the chart twice in the round once on each needle if using circs repeat rounds 16 21 until you have achieved the desired length taking care that you end with a round 21 in the last round 21 that you work m2 sts on your second needle as follows work sts on needle 1 as chart 36 sts on needle 2 work 3 sts m1 work remaining 33 sts m1 when doing a m1 in stranded knitting i find it works best to lift both colour strands and k them through the back loop but feel free to experiment shift the first 3 sts on needle 2 onto needle 1 so the sts on needle 2 start and finish with the newly made ones heel for your reference i have included the last round on needle 2 with the heel chart work the heel over the 35 sts on needle 2 by turning and starting with a purl row following the heel chart i have worked my heel with a needle size smaller to get a firmer texture but that is a matter of choice i have found that you will get a cleaner edge if you slip the first st in every row and either k or p the last st in each row with both colour strands these sts are noted with a special symbol in the chart if you have problems purling stranded like i did then firstly i would urge you to persevere as it is a useful skill to have and you only have to struggle for 16 row however if this is seriously spoiling your enjoyment you can cheat by working the ws row separately for each colour using the first colour simply only purl the colours that are supposed to be worked in the first colour and slip the other sts p wise then shift the sts to the other end of the needle and using the second colour work all the sts that are meant to be in that colour slipping the sts in the first colour make sure the last st is still purled with both strands woodruff page 3 having completed all 31 row of the chart turn the heel as follows all through the heel turn main- tain the established 1x1 stripe row1 sl1 work in the established
